titleStmt.title: Iames by the grace of God king of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. to all and singular archbishops, bishops, archdeacons, deanes and their officials ... greeting : whereas we are credibly giuen to vnderstand aswell by the humble supplication and petition of one religious Philotheos, a Grecian, and procurator generall of the Conuent of the Holy Crosse of Golgotha, in Ierusalem ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)

titleStmt.title: Iames by the grace of God king of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. to all and singular archbishops, bishops, archdeacons, deanes and their officials ... greeting : whereas we are credibly giuen to vnderstand aswell by the humble supplication and petition of one religious Philotheos, a Grecian, and procurator generall of the Conuent of the Holy Crosse of Golgotha, in Ierusalem ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

notesStmt.note: Title and other title information from first 7 lines of text.
"Witnesse Our Selfe at Westminster the thiteenth day of October, in the nineteenth yeare of Our raigne of England, France and Ireland, and of Scotland the fiue and fiftieth."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.

orgName.name: Convent of the Holy Cross of Golgotha (Jerusalem)
